name: Bowman's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bowmans is situated in a one way street with permit parking about 15min walk from the Minster. We contacted the owners prior to our stay and they were more than happy to sort a parking permit out early in the day for us as we were eager to head into York centre. We were able to get parked up and collect the room key at 10am which was great as it gave us the full day to look around. The owners were very friendly and made us feel at home.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: We stayed in room 2, the blue room at the front of the property which was very nice with a half tester bed. A shower over the bath with lovely warm water and dove droducts were provided (shower gel, shampoo etc) which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Like Home From Home Fantastic

reviews.text: Another nice touch was that on the first day we were left a bar of chocolate and a bottle of water in the room which I`ve never encountered anywhere else I`ve stayed which was very nice.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great with a good choice of ingreedients for the fry up. We got a couple of taxis during our stay as we had walked lots during the day. A taxi to the oposite side of york to the Opera house was about six pound which we thought was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: All in all Bowmans is a very nice B&B and a great base for seeing the sites of York
reviews.title: The Top Gem in York's Hotels, 5 Star plus in every way.

reviews.text: My sister and I visited York last week and stayed at Bowman's. We received a warm welcome at this lovely B&B. We stayed in the blue room on the second floor at the front of the hotel, with twin beds. You could just see the top of the Minster. The room is modern and clean and we even had a sighting of steam train from our window on its way back into the Station! The breakfast was very tasty and filling. The B&B is in a quiet and pleasant location, only a short walk from town and all the attractions. Would definitely recommend this B&B to everyone and plan to go back next year for a trip on a steam train.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb location, superb hosts, magnificent breakfasts and out of this world service. What more could you want for a weekend break. LOOK NO FURTHER, YOU'VE FOUND IT.! Debbie and David are the best we have found in years of travelling. Nothing is too much trouble and the little extras are far too many to mention. Bowmans is just a short pleasant walk into the bustling area of York. You must visit, seeing is believing.
reviews.title: If this isn't No. 1, it should be!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We will definitely return to the "Minster Blue Room"
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: We returned today from York where we stayed at Bowman's for two nights. I have stayed there before and could not recommend it enough and would go as far as saying whenever we go to York we will stay with Debbie and David,
reviews.title: Wonderful, brilliant, a real gem

reviews.text: As usual our room was spotless, the house was lovely and everything you wanted was there. Debbie could not do enough to make us or anyone else there feel more welcome, including a rather difficult and demanding guest who seemed to think that a lift into town from Debbie was part of the deal (worth a try i suppose) along with many other bizarre requests. All I can say is that Debbie has the patience of an angel. Loved it and will be back again.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from our stay at Bowman's, York. Over many years this was the 5th b & b we have stayed at in York and by far the best. Debra was so welcoming, very friendly and bubbly and could not do enough for you. I won't single any particular thing out, just say that everything was excellent and we will definitely be staying there again, on our return visits.
reviews.title: Excellent York B & B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You would struggle to find a better place to stay in York than Bowman's. A lovely room with space to move, marvelous breakfasts, wonderful hosts ... what more could you ask for? The location is fantastic - it is only a short walk to all the main attractions in York. When we picked up our hire car, parking wasn't a problem either. We would most certainly stay here again if we ever get back to York.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay in York

reviews.text: By the way, if you look at Bowman's location on a map, don't be put off by the railway line opposite. It is only a branch line with hardly any trains during the day, nothing overnight and double-glazing to keep the noise out anyway!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Bowman's for two nights and it was wonderful. Debra was so welcoming and David's breakfasts were delicious and plentiful. All the things I would expect to be of a high standard were; a superbly clean room and en-suite, highly helpful hosts and a lovely variety of food. However, it was all the extra little touches that made Bowman's so special -
reviews.title: Do not miss this beautiful B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: lovely toiletries, a bottle of water, chocolate, loads of coathangers. Nothing was too much trouble. This was my first stay at Bowman's, but it certainly won't be my last. A gem of a B and B.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: couldnt fault it.... spotlessly clean, fabulous food and wonderful hosts. everything that a good hotel should be. perfect home from home.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Debra is the ideal hostess - gracious, sincere, and attentive to every detail. She and David's guest house was ideal for us - warm, cozy, and yet respectful of privacy. The breakfast room had small round tables so we could talk with our fellow diners or could simply enjoy the view , the fire, and the delicious food. We had a full English breakfast with the room, and I appreciated that everything was fresh and well cooked - no greasy, nasty sausages here!
reviews.title: We'd like to move in! What a relaxed and lovely stay!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Gold Room at Bowman's; it was on the small side but beautifully decorated and had everything we could want: our own tea service, TV, hair dryer, and even two complimentary chocolate bars! The Bowmans had completely and carefully renovated the whole building. I appreciated that everything was immaculately clean, bright and in excellent condition.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.text: The location was great - an easy, pretty walk to town center. We admired the flowers in the adjoining residences and strolled along the river. It's obvious that Debra loves what she's doing and delights in sharing her love of beautiful, comfortable surroundings and entertaining with her guests. She has a lovely, relaxed manner and sense of humor that quickly put us at ease.
reviews.title: A lot of friendly fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I agreed that staying with the Bowmans will be one of the highlights of our trip to Great Britain. The days in York flew by. As we wished Debra good-bye, I got a little sad, realizing that it's so far for us to visit. I'd plan on staying here often if we could.
reviews.title: Perfect

description: Bowman's is a recently refurbished Victorian Terraced House situated approximately 5 minutes walk from York Minster. Debra and David offer you a warm welcome and relaxing stay in a beautifully appointed guesthouse.
